reviews.text:
The soft play area is great fun for toddlers (18mo+ limit) and very young children. As grandparents we ended up joining in with our 24mo old girl.
It all looked clean and I have no idea what is triggered when they enter but she was keen to go round and get to the slides. One slightly tricky bit, coming out of a partially clear tunnel onto a lattice of straps but with a quarter open to allow access from below, caused some nervousness that required grandparent involvement but mostly just tearing around.
The location is slightly off the main roads and is undistinguished. The doors are on an electric lock and the flooring as you enter the reception area is plain concrete: the industrial look (perhaps).
There is a reception desk and some snacks and drinks available (photos attached)â€¦.including child friendly items, such as rice cakes etc.
We didnâ€™t visit the yoga studio(s?) which are off to the right as you enter, heading straight ahead to the soft play studio. This has obviously been repurposed as there is a ballet bar on the wall. Sofas and settees and a few tables and chairs give viewers the chance to watch - or catch your breath between scampering after your little darlings when they want some company.
It was quite full when we went (Bank holiday Monday 10:00) but that made it fun for the little ones, as they could watch older children tearing around.
Everyone was polite and with one exception (a little boy) well behaved and allowing time for others.
I would highly recommend this as a place for young children.

PRICES
Costs were Â£7 per child and Â£3 per adult. No food allowed in the play area but otherwise you could bring your own.

This is my local yoga studio in London and had been the best studio in the area for iyengar for many years, and you can be sure to find high quality teaching here. Pilates too on offer, proper coffee machine in the cafe, and a soft play downstairs for kids too. An all round brilliant space for wellness and all the ages.

Can't recommend Yogaloft highly enough. Wish I would have found it earlier.  As someone with nearly two decades of practice I deeply appreciate the great range of highly experienced teachers who genuinely engage and support students in reasonably-sized classes.  Yogaloft has a community vibe that other studios have long lost and as others have commented on, the people at reception are super-welcoming and helpful.
Nice studio; however the quality of classes can vary quite widely depending on the instructor. I have been disappointed a few times, so it can feel like a roll of a dice when booking a class.

DO NOT use this place for a kids birthday party.
They have one cubicle in the menâ€™s toilets which is unacceptable when you are hosting kids aged 1-4 years old. My son had to pee himself because that one cubicle was occupied for a long time.

They also have a thing for not giving away the wifi password despite the fact that there is no reception in the playroom and I specifically told them I needed it because my wife was pregnant and alone at home.

Never encountered such a ridiculous policy of not giving a wifi password to paying customers in 2023 even if its for emergency use only!

Save your money for a church hall as they will treat you better ðŸ˜…

address: 27 Beethoven St, London W10 4LG, United Kingdom
